result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Kamenchie S Davis was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concur to 21CF2630 and 21CF499.
Concurrent with: 21CF2630 and 21CF499
IID restriction effective upon licensure for 14 mo.

miscConds.notes: Court costs remitted. $417  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  Court authorized payment plan. Def may reduce amount of fine by amount of assessment fee if receipt is provided to COC.
Defendant not to use or possess any weapon.
Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with TNC. Not use/possess alcohol.   Maintain absolute sobriety. No physical abuse of children.

Parenting classes if indicated by the agent. Alcohol monitoring until agent terminates.   Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified. DNA on file.   Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

timeConds.notes: With huber. Provisions of 973.09(1)(d) (Good Time) apply.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kamenchie S Davis

records.addlTxt:
Based on financial information provided to the Court by the defendant, the Court has found that the defendant's household income is no more than 150% of the federal nonfarm poverty guideline.
Therefore it is Ordered that an Ignition Interlock Device (IID) shall be installed and maintained for 50% of the normal costs.
of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Copy of amended minutes from PLEAS Hrg on 5/12/22 sent electronically to DOC

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt:
10:59 AM Defendant in court with Attorney David Kennedy Anderson.  ADA Carl Jacob Lazarus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
  
Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 1.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count #2, 3 and 4. 

Victim rights compliance.

COUNT #1    
Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 2 years, cc 21CF2630 and 21CF499

CONDITIONS:
-Serve 10 days in DCJ, w/Huber and good time, to commence on  
-No contact, direct or indirect with TNC 
-Not use/possess alcohol
- Parenting class if indicated by the agent
-Absolute sobriety
-No Physical Abuse of Childent
-Alochol monitoring until agent terminates
-No weapons
-Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals 
-DNA on file
-Any other conditions DOC may impose

COURT COSTS:
Ct #1
$350 Fine 
-All CC and DNA surcharge waived. V/W surcharge due w/in 60 days. Payment plan approved.

-Revocation of drivers license for 14 months 
-Ignition Interlock Device required upon licensure for 14 months
-1/2 Price IID
-AODA assessment (Defendant may reduce amount of fine by amount of assessment fee if receipt is provided to COC) 

CREDIT:
-Days credit for time served: zero days
-Days credit if revoked: zero days

DE advised of post-conviction rights

Abby H./minutes emailed to DOC

5/12/22 AMENDED MINUTES
Jail to commence on June 20, 2022 at 7 am. Fine and VW surcharge due w/in 60 days. Payment plan approved. - Cassandra S
Status conference on June 27, 2022 at 02:20 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall report to the Dane County Jail to complete the booking/fingerprinting process within 10 days of today. 
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid license. 
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle with any alcohol in their system. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 2 

Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.

11:19 AM Defendant appeared.  Andrea Beth Raymond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 02:20 pm.
